meanings.definition: The act of passing something from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the players made quick handoffs of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The nurse made smooth handoffs of the medical supplies to her colleague.
meanings.sent3: The handoffs of snacks at the party were so fast, it felt like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The handoffs of information between the teams were like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The handoffs of the baton in the relay race were crucial for the team's success.

meanings.definition: A relay race in which a baton is passed from one runner to another.
meanings.sent1: The team practiced their handoffs to improve their relay race performance.
meanings.sent2: The final handoff in the relay race determined the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent3: During the relay race, the handoffs of the baton were like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent4: The smooth handoffs of the baton symbolized teamwork and coordination.
meanings.sent5: The handoffs of the baton were executed flawlessly, leading the team to victory.
